one_reviews_text: Garbage even by BBC standards which are very low. Pure nonsense, totally uninspiring, not even interesting to play to a 5 years old. Total waste of time. Wonder how this crap gets funding.. I thought the Oculus store had higher standards regarding what gets published..

This was beyond a waste of time. You start in the Tardis and you never move. All you do is get the sonic screwdriver and point at a couple of things and that is it. Entire experience was 15 minutes of standing in one spot looks at the interior of, what? Prehistoric Tardis? Sorry but this was lame.

Although I had a little trouble understanding what was being said at times, I really enjoyed the experience. As a Doctor Who fan it was an experience worth every moment I spent on it and as someone who has admittedly not yet met the 13th Doctor it made me want to get to know her better so now I'm looking forward to starting into those episodes. While I would have preferred my actions to actually mean something as that would have made it feel even more immersive, the way it was done made it an interactive, yet comfortable experience that allows it to be accessible to everyone. I felt zero motion sickness during this experience, loved the art style, and felt it was more than worth the price. I'm hopeful that there will be more of these experiences in the future as this is one of the best VR experiences I have had so far!
I love Doctor Who and Jodie Whitaker a lot as well, it's short but as a Doctor Who fan it is amazing for real

I really liked this. Jodie Whittaker has done a very good job voice acting The Doctor here as well. I wish it was even a little teensy bit longer, like The Doctor showing you space outside the TARDIS for example. I feel like the team who worked on this should definitely write a longer story specifically made for VR. I'd buy that 100%.

The 13th Doctor has to be one of my new faves. Think of Stever Irwin, only traveling through time and space. This was exciting, scary, and an absolute blast! And now I get why every new person drug along, well, I won't spoil your ride, but go for it!

Its short, Not very interactive, but its very well written. The Gameplay is okay, would love to see more though.

Love Dr.Who
if you are a doctor who fan you have to try it
It is very good interactive game
Especially great as a work of character writing. Fun experience
I loved it, it made me dream, and it made my dream come true : Travel with my favorite doctor!
I can imagine kids might like it, but this got on my nerves. The Edge of Time is a million times better.
Really nice story, well polished with audio, graphics, and feedback controls. Wish it was longer.

Wish it was longer, I was playing it not knowing it was a you know, small story, and I was thoroughly enjoying it!  It had a lot of treats for people who always wanted any kind of Dr. Who game back in the day ;)  The animation is stellar.  The production is very good.  Edge of Time was fair (I liked it) but this makes a nice companion piece.
This was a fun experience, very family friendly.

Tardis control was nicely done with a well voiced cast. Nice and accurate with your sonic scredrivers and bits with fine art across the board. 
Only gave it 4 as it's not that long but you really can't complain all that much for the price!
I'm not even a Doctor Who fan, but I might be after stuff like this.  It was well animated and fun.  It is a good quick experience for adults and kids alike.  =)

Jodie really made this fun with her fun banter and excitment. The animation was fun too! Easily suspended belief and made comfortable to be in this world! More please much more. I cant think of a show more suited to being in VR. Thanks.
A fun game with cute animation. The Doctor was perfect in this version, full of wonder and excitement. Nice way to introduce the DW world to VR
Thought this was a cute little experience. Nice graphics, fun, loved it - well worth it for a freebie.
This game is well done but feels like an experience more than an interactive game. The story is short but fun for a free game. I recommand it !

Cute little adventure, fun and interactive. I`m not really a fan of Jodie Whittakers portrayal of the doctor, (I stopped watching when they changed the character). But as a way to spend a fun quarter of an hour, this VR experience is OK.
It was short and sweet, the minigame parts were pointless and didn't affect the story though. Overall i enjoyed it.

review_title: Please sir, can I have some more?
one_reviews_text: Urrmmm, well that was thoroughly immense! If you like Dr Who, you'll love this experience. Sadly it left me craving more, especially with that outro! I could absolutely see this being a fantastic episodic adventure. This needs to be an episodic adventure!

I've seen some doctor who vr rip offs and i can assure you.... this is NOT one of them, EVERYTHING WAS COOL! LOVED THE ACTING! (And Jodie Whittakers acting) please doctor who if you did help with this, script an episodic experience for everyone to enjoy without payment! THIS IS BY FAR THE BEST VR GAME IV EEXPERIENCED!!! SO SMOOTH THE ANIMATIONS! buuuut the lip syncing was like 1 seccond off but it doesnt matter though :D still gonna play this every evening!

Wow, where did this appear from? Very very well polished experience from the BBC. Go to stuff when you've got your friends around and want to show them VR. Well done BBC (and Jodie W for participating, you made this soooo relatable).  Can't wait for the next thing you're cooking up BBC team, you're actually putting Britain on the VR map with this (despite ruddy Brexit!). Keep it up!
If you haven't tried this, just do, it's free and you wont regret the used disk space . Superb.

First off be aware this is a very short experience - probably about 15 minutes - but it is fun and immersive, and it's a great way to really feel a part of the Doctor Who universe.

There's something about the acting (Jodie Whittaker's voice and some Motion Capture magic) which is really engaging. It really feels like you are in an episode right there alongside the Doctor. I was very impressed by the way she followed you as you moved, although disappointed the game 'blacks out' if you move away from the centre spot.

The actual interaction is pretty slim with some basic movement with one hand - but boy did it feel good to get my hands on the sonic screwdriver! It was great getting a hands on closeup and worked well enough.

The graphics are simple but stylised and it just looks good. They haven't tried for realism, which was wise, and the end result is great. The story is fairly typical Who stuff, you either love it or you don't, but the experience surpasses that in my experience.

Given it's free, you really can't complain, and there's no point not having a go! I hope the BBC carry on making more VR content, and hopefully more about the Doctor.

When I saw this earlier today, I wasn't expecting much, but when I downloaded it and launched it, I regretted everything I thought before. The graphics are stunning, the voice acting is great. The alien was soo cute, and the modelling of the Tardis looked very nice and accurate. (Other than there were no custard creams if you know what I'm referencing here). Was sad it was quite short, but the ending really made me hyped for the next part of the story. Must get if you love Doctor Who! :)

very good .. worth the view .. hope their more to come and do be carefull with streaming this .. as you will get hit with a copy right notices and the BBC should have said something with some info at top of this page .. thank you BBC .. this is a good start .. dont fall of track and mess it up.........

This is a really cool, free VR experience that'll especially appeal to fans of Doctor Who. There's even a bit of interactive gameplay, although the main point is to enjoy the short story and awesome voice acting by Jodie Whittaker.

It's very much quality over quantity with this game. A short little adventure set in the Tardis with the Doctor. There is minimal interaction but it's a joy to witness. Hopefully there is more to come?
This is brill, would love to see it on the quest, it's so much better than some of the paid for content available!
Despite its really short length this is a fun little VR experience, super smooth animations and good atmosphere, superb for it being free.
The lady is awful that is about it : )
...and very entertaining. Looking forvard to more.
As The Doctor, I am super pleased with this. Feels like im really there. I noticed I decorated..... I don't like it :)
Really well done can not wait for the one coming later this year please make it avalible for everyone not just the UK

review_title: Not a Dr Who fan, but this was great!
one_reviews_text: Lovely visual style to this.  Just good fun.  Great mocap and voice work.  Not much interactivity - but for free - excellent.
A fun and cute little adventure. More please!
Not much gameplay-wise, but its still a fun bite-sized doctor who experience.
Very enjoyable little experience! Would definitely love to see more!
I have to admit, this was fun, short but fun, and yes, more please.
Great little game , very enjoyable
Luv it, shame it was the girl doctor but still coool!
Short and good.

review_title: Best way to meet my Doctor!
one_reviews_text:
So I recently saw this gem of a game and it was so captivating while watching... Everything about it was just breathtaking to experience!

The Doctor was as powerful as ever and Jodie Whittaker has really got the power when voicing her character like in the previous TV Series last year.

Volta is a really cute character, he has my up most support as me and the Doctor try to calm him down and it really shows how sad he is, obviously by his adorable emotions, about losing his parents.

The Tardis is beautiful when animated as whenever I look around, it looks stunning when detailed this nicely. And about the animation, it is decent but nicely done by the team at Passion Animation Studios, they really did a good job!

Even the music is beautiful to listen to! Like Series 11 of Doctor Who, Segun Akinola had composed such calm to epic music. It really captures the spirit of the environment of the game.

Overall this game, like I said, is a gem that I will never forget. It makes me feel like I'm actually part of the story and interacting with the Doctor! Even though it's short, it was written well and is truly a wonderful special 'virtual reality' episode that I will remember forever and always.
A lovely and sweet little game introducing you into Doctor Who within VR!
It's actually really fun. It's really immersive and the alien is adorable. I love it! Just quite short which is kinda said but fun nontheless.
